events.description: The S&P/ASX 200 reached a four-week low following broad-based selling.
A tech-driven decline in US markets overnight influenced local sentiment.
Rio Tinto ended takeover discussions with Glencore after failing to agree on deal value.

facts.fact_text: The S&P/ASX 200 slid more than 1.5% to around 8,750 in early Friday trade.

evidences.evidence_text: The S&P/ASX 200 slid more than 1.5% to around 8,750 in early Friday trade, touching a four-week low

facts.fact_text: Technology stocks plunged over 4% to reach more than a two-year low.

evidences.evidence_text: Technology stocks led the decline, plunging over 4% to reach more than a two-year low.

facts.fact_text: Rio Tinto ended takeover talks with Glencore.

evidences.evidence_text: Rio Tinto has also ended takeover talks with Glencore after the companies failed to agree on a deal

claims.claim_text: Broad-based selling and the Wall Street slump weighed heavily on market sentiment.

evidences.evidence_text: broad-based selling in local resource-linked stocks and a tech-driven slump on Wall Street overnight weighed heavily on sentiment.

claims.claim_text: Technology stocks are tracking US tech giants lower due to weak earnings and AI trade concerns.

evidences.evidence_text: tracking US tech giants lower amid weak earnings results and concerns over AI trade.

claims.claim_text: The benchmark index is headed for its biggest weekly decline since mid-November last year.

evidences.evidence_text: Over the week, the benchmark index is headed for its biggest weekly decline since mid November last year.

evidence.evidence_text: a tech-driven slump on Wall Street overnight weighed heavily on sentiment.
Gold miners also dropped 3.7% on weak bullion prices
tracking US tech giants lower amid weak earnings results and concerns over AI trade.
